title: How Waze Crowdsources Traffic
description: One-minute skill: How Waze Crowdsources Traffic.

hook.text: Every Waze user is a sensor. Your phone's speed data feeds a real-time traffic map used by millions.

buildup.text: Israeli startup Waze launched in 2008. Users reported accidents, police, and road hazards in real time.

discovery.text: The app learned that rerouting even 10% of drivers away from a jam clears the congestion for everyone.

twist.text: Google bought Waze for $1.1 billion in 2013. Quiet residential streets started filling with diverted traffic.

climax.text: Some neighborhoods fought back, reporting fake accidents to keep Waze from routing through their streets.

punchline.text: An app that fixes traffic created new traffic wars.

quiz.question: How does Waze gather traffic data?
options: Phone speed data from every user driving with the app
